I am located in Los Angeles with {years} years of experience working at studios including Disney Animation, ILM, Pixar, Dreamworks TV and The Mill.
I enjoys creating unique graphics and solving technical challenges with nodes and codes.

When I am free I like to take pictures, bouldering and brew coffee.

# Colophon
I build this website mostly for recording the more technical aspect of projects that is hard to show in a reel

Also for storing my notes and process when I work on project
I want this site to look simple and unique, avoid cookie-cutter UI components
Leave out planty of breathing room, only show necessary info

## Features
- Responsive design
- Edit content using Markdown
- Manage content with Frontmatter CMS in VSCode
- Emojis

# Automating my demo reel 
I started using nixos on my server, it's a procedural os so every settings of the computer is defined in the configuration file. For my reel, why can't it do the same?
- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BBFub0zErFA
- https://zulko.github.io/moviepy/getting_started/index.html


## Issue encounter
Compositing a compositVideoClip on a video cause the edge to be pixalated. It looks like it's an alpha issue. To get around this, I just export the text as individual object,
instead of a compositVideoClip. 
[Probably related bug](https://github.com/Zulko/moviepy/issues/1472)

```python
combine_clip_text =CompositeVideoClip([title_clip,studio_clip,description_clip],size=(1920*2,1080*2))
combine_clip =CompositeVideoClip(video,combine_clip_text)
```

# How to use Copernicus the wrong way
> **`WIP post`**
- I was trying to use **Copernicus** as a Nuke replacement, 
- there isn't a redirection of what replace what 


> TODO:
> - pictures of node, examples
## Common nodes nuke equivalent
| Copernicus |  Nuke|
|--------|----|
| File | Read|
| over | blend|
| noise | fractalnoise|
| remap | fit+ramp|
| bright | grade gain|
| hsv | satuation, value, hue|
| transform | transform|
| channel swap/add/split/extract | shuffle|
| glow | glow|

### Interesting nodes
- dilateerode = dilate
- chromaticaberration
